title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.10.5 | 27-05-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ज्ञानतिमिरान्धस्य ज्ञानान्जनिषलाकया चक्षुरुन्मीलितं येनातस्मै श्री गुरवेनमहा नमा ओम् विष्णु पादाया कृष्ण प्रिष्ठाय भूतले श्रीमते भक्ति वेदान्त स्वामिन्नितिनामिने नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गौरवाणी प्रचार
विष्णु पादाया कृष्णु पादाया कृष्णु पादाया कृष्णु पादाया कृष्णु पादाया कृष्णु पादाया कृष्णु पादाया कृष्णु पादाया कृष्णु पादाया कृष्णु पादाया कृष्णु पादाया कृष्णु पादाया कृष
the departure of Lord Krishna for Dwarka before actually describing the departure in this chapter
it is described the rule of King Yudhishthira after Yudhishthira assumed the post of the emperor
of the world after the Battle of Kurukshetra then how was he ruling that's being described
here in the initial portion of this chapter the fifth verse says Nadia samadra giraya
The meaning of this verses religious Oceans hills mountains and falls of the oceans are
mountains and falls of the mountains and falls of the mountains and falls of the mountains

forest creepers and active drugs in every season paid their tax quota to the king in profusion this is an interesting concept here this verse is talking about rivers paying their tax quota to the king and they were paying in profusion plenty there was plenty

of water in the rivers of all kinds of valuables in the ocean in the hills in the mountains that's being explained in the purport by Srila Prabhupada so it's not just the citizens alone who pay the tax and even among the citizens in the very culture only the vices pay tax the kshatriyas are rulers

and the brahmanas they voluntarily accept to lead a very simple life they don't accumulate money they don't even accumulate goods and the shudras are never given money they are given all the necessities they are taken care of by their masters because they always have to be under the protection of a brahmana and a shudra

a kshatriya or a vaisya so they're taken care completely they are never given money because there is a possibility that they may misuse the money for wrong purposes they don't have sufficiently developed intelligence to understand the consequences of spending money for let's say

smoking drinking gambling etc whereas what about the vices who have money in their hands or the kshatriyas the vices and kshatriyas are responsible they are sufficiently engaged in their duties they are very strictly there are strict followers of the vedic injunctions so they are not only responsible but they are also responsible for the

they are naturally protected and they are careful so generally vaisyas brahmana kshatriyas vaisyas do not indulge in sinful activities even if they have ample opportunity for doing that they don't do it generally they don't do it so therefore money should not be given to the shudras that doesn't mean that they should not be given to the shudras

that shudras are exploited as sometimes modern-day people think bonded labor no it's not bonded labor it is protection it is giving them a chance to utilize this human form of life for spiritual advancement and thereby achieve the ultimate purpose of this human form of life which is self-realization the leading part of the human form of life

going back to godhead even shudras are eligible for that everyone is eligible every human being is eligible especially if they follow the process of bhakti they chant harry krishna anyone who chants harry krishna under proper guidance can make spiritual advancement to achieve perfection irrespective of what their material background may be
the tax was collected by the king only from the vaisyas
so then how will the king manage the kingdom when there are a lot of expenses
the king would also receive the gifts of nature in profusion because he was ruling according to the principles of dharma that will be explained here
in the parpo shila prabhupada says
since maharaj yudhishthira was under the protection of the ajita
ajita is another name for krishna the infallible lord
the properties of the lord namely the rivers the oceans the hills the forests etc were all pleased
and they used to supply the respective quota of taxes to the king
they are the property of the supreme lord
the secret to success is to take refuge under the protection of the supreme lord
that is the secret of success
for the king to properly rule the kingdom without experiencing any scarcity
ultimately for every single thing the supreme lord's sanction is absolutely required
to make economic development by our own endeavors on the strength of tools and machinery is not all
like it is happening in the modern times
the sanction of the supreme lord must be there otherwise
despite all instrumental arrangements everything will be unsuccessful
the ultimate cause of success is daiva the supreme
in the 18th chapter of the bhagavad gita krishna explains
to be considered for successful accomplishment of every action in this material world
the four factors are in our hands
it's in our hands four factors
but the fifth factor is called daivam
the super soul the personality of god krishna satan in our heart is paramatma
ultimately the cause of success is daiva
or the supreme lord krishna as paramatma in the heart
no action can be successfully accomplished
of course that does not mean
that we neglect the other four factors which are in our hands
like they should be proper endeavor
they should be the proper place or conditions for
there should be the effort on the part of the particular person the doer
a doer is required for the accomplishment of any action
an effort or endeavor by a doer
under the guidance of a leader
and without the proper instruments of action
daiva is very very important factor
people who are other non devotees
they do not know or they don't care for this fifth factor
kings like maharaj yudhishthira knew perfectly well
that the king is the agent of the supreme lord
to look after the welfare of the mass of people
here the concept of welfare state is coming
the king is ruling as the representative of krishna
ultimately krishna is the supreme ruler
so if there is a king who is ruling a particular province
or a state or a kingdom
as an agent of the supreme lord krishna only
actually the state belongs to the supreme lord
the rivers oceans forests hills drugs etc
they are all creations of the supreme lord
is allowed to make use of the property of the lord
for the service of the lord
which are the property of the lord
that everything is for the people
and therefore the government is for the people
to produce a new species of humanity
on the basis of god consciousness
the world has to again follow
in the footsteps of kings like
by the will of the lord
and we can make proper use of the things
the control of the lord is there everywhere
and if the lord is pleased
every part of nature will be pleased
the ocean will supply sufficient quantity of minerals
what is the use of the ocean
and the seasonal changes will effectively help
produce fruits and flowers in profuse quantity
of any of the basic needs
Prabhupada is commenting about the modern civilization
which is the case in the modern civilization
a method of mass producing these
and diverting their attention from the
simply we have to become god conscious
